topline_md: Recent updates in NYC include a journalist hospitalized after an altercation with police outside an immigration court, two individuals injured in a shooting in Fordham, and the introduction of new laws allowing homeowners to convert attics and basements into apartments.

civic_information.title: Civic Information
civic_information.summary_md:
### Civic Information

U.S. government shutdown could impact NYC museums and parks, while new housing regulations and public records initiatives are introduced.

- NYC museums and parks may close if a government shutdown occurs. [Read](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Homeowners can now legally convert attics and basements into apartments and build tiny houses in backyards. [Read](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- A judge has dismissed hundreds of sexual-abuse lawsuits related to NYC juvenile jails. transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.summary_md:
### Transportation

Transportation updates reveal significant service changes and new policies affecting commuters in New York City.

- NYC plans to convert 34th Street into a busway by the end of 2025, limiting car access.
